Home Safety Tips

Prevention by Topic

Prevent Fires Caused by Smoking

  • Fire safety experts suggest that matches and cigarette lighters are better kept out of sight and out of the reach of children.
  • Make it a habit to stub cigarettes out properly and dispose of them carefully. Fire experts recommend dousing cigarette butts with water before discarding.
  • Consider having several large, non-tip ashtrays, set on level surfaces available in smoking areas, and emptying them often.
  • Before going to bed, it is a good habit to check around and under seat cushions for smoldering cigarette butts.
  • Fire authorities recommend not smoking in bed, while lying down, or if you are feeling drowsy.
  • Learn more about the potential hazards of smoking in your home
  • If you have guests to your home who smoke, learn how to keep your home fire safe
